ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.10'

about.description:
pg8000 is a Pure-Python interface to the PostgreSQL database engine.  It is
one of many PostgreSQL interfaces for the Python programming language.
pg8000 is somewhat distinctive in that it is written entirely in Python and
does not rely on any external libraries (such as a compiled python module,
or PostgreSQL's libpq library). pg8000 supports the standard Python DB-API
version 2.0.
pg8000's name comes from the belief that it is probably about the 8000th
PostgreSQL interface for Python.

pg8000 is a Pure-Python interface to the PostgreSQL database engine.  It is
one of many PostgreSQL interfaces for the Python programming language.
pg8000 is somewhat distinctive in that it is written entirely in Python and
does not rely on any external libraries (such as a compiled python module,
or PostgreSQL's libpq library). pg8000 supports the standard Python DB-API
version 2.0.
pg8000's name comes from the belief that it is probably about the 8000th
PostgreSQL interface for Python.

name: pg8000
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "pg8000" %}
{% set version = "1.31.5" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 46ebb03be52b7a77c03c725c79da2ca281d6e8f59577ca66b17c9009618cae78

build:
  number: 0
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv --no-deps --no-build-isolation
  noarch: python

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip
    - hatchling
    - versioningit >=3.3.0
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}
    - scramp >=1.4.5
    - python-dateutil >=2.8.2

test:
  imports:
    - pg8000
  commands:
    - pip check
    - python -c 'import pg8000; print(pg8000.__version__)'
  requires:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip

about:
  home: https://codeberg.org/tlocke/pg8000
  license: MIT
  license_family: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: PostgreSQL interface library

  description: |
    pg8000 is a Pure-Python interface to the PostgreSQL database engine.  It is
    one of many PostgreSQL interfaces for the Python programming language.
    pg8000 is somewhat distinctive in that it is written entirely in Python and
    does not rely on any external libraries (such as a compiled python module,
    or PostgreSQL's libpq library). pg8000 supports the standard Python DB-API
    version 2.0.
    pg8000's name comes from the belief that it is probably about the 8000th
    PostgreSQL interface for Python.

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - nicolas-geniteau
    - maximerihouey
    - ncolomer
    - xylar
